fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49558].
  {panel}

*Description*
If you include Team Calendar macro in Confluence page, and when you set it to list view, the start date and end date displayed wrongly, if the event was set for one month long.

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a people calendar if you don't have any.
# Create an event to any user, and set the event to be more than one month long (e.g. 4th of April to 5th of May)
# Go to a random Confluence space
# Create a new page
# Embed Team Calendars macro (Select a people calendar)
# Select list view
# Save the page
# Click the event

*Expected Result*
The event start date and end date would be correct, for example if you set it to 4th of April to 5th of May it should show as "4 April - 5 May"

*Current Result*
The timing would be wrong, it will be shown on the same month. For example if you set it from 4th of April to 5th of May will be shown as "4 May - 5 May"
fields.summary: Wrong event start and end data shown on list view on Team Calendar Macro

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49546].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Use IE8
# Create a page with a Team Calendars macro in list form
# Add enough new lines to push the macro down off the immediately visible page (ie, you should end up with a full page of new lines)
# Click on the tools menu, and browse down to another menu item

*Expected Results:*
The menu should work as normal.

*Actual Results:*
The menu disappears as soon as you mouse over any menu item.

*Workaround:* 
Use 'Month' view instead of list view.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49538].
  {panel}

Customers who are running Confluence 4.3.x (and potentially other versions of Confluence) are finding that their indexing becomes broken when Team Calendars v3.2.3 is enabled in their instance. The index appears to run successful but refreshing the page suggests that the Index isn't rebuilt, even though they have just run the process.

h3. Symptoms
# Index is not working
# Can not create new spaces

Looking in the atlassian-confluence logs, a very distinct error is shown:

{noformat}
2013-06-13 13:50:05,471 ERROR [Indexer: 8] [confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch] indexCollection Error indexing document
 -- referer: http://localhost:6430/admin/search-indexes.action | url: /admin/reindex.action | userName: admin | action: reindex
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.atlassian.confluence.index.Lucene29FieldDescriptorMapper
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.impl.Lucene29AdaptingExtractor.<init>(Lucene29AdaptingExtractor.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.impl.Lucene29ExtractorFactory.convert(Lucene29ExtractorFactory.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.spring.DynamicExtractorModuleDescriptorsFactory$CompatibilityExtractor.addFields(DynamicExtractorModuleDescriptorsFactory.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.search.BaseDocumentBuilder.getDocument(BaseDocumentBuilder.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ConfluenceDocumentBuilder.getDocument(ConfluenceDocumentBuilder.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.AddDocumentIndexTask.perform(AddDocumentIndexTask.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.index.TempIndexWriter.perform(TempIndexWriter.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.TempIndexWriterStrategy.perform(TempIndexWriterStrategy.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.TempIndexBackedIndexTaskPerformer.perform(TempIndexBackedIndexTaskPerformer.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.indexCollection(ReindexWorkBatch.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch$1.doInTransaction(ReindexWorkBatch.java:86)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.run(ReindexWorkBatch.java:56)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:439)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
{noformat}

h3. Resolution
# Upgrade the plugin to v3.2.4 or above, which can be downloaded here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars
# Reindex your instance following these instructions: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+Index+Administration
fields.summary: Confluence stops indexing after upgrading Team Calendars plugin to v3.2.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49524].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new event
# Type the event name under "What" field
# Click the "Repeat" drop down menu
# Press the arrows (up or down) to choose the drop down item (example: Weekly)
# Press ENTER on Weekly Repeat (do NOT click with mouse to choose this)

h4. Expected Results
"Repeat every xx month/week/year/day" field is shown

h4. Actual Results
*IE 8.0.7 with Confluence 4.3.7*
Once ENTER is pressed, the event is created and a new "Create Event" box is shown (with the same values as previously entered, except that it's only a one day event). As a result, there are two events are created, as seen from the screenshot below. One is the repeat event and the other is the 1 day event. 
!double-events.png!

*IE 8 (with Confluence 5.1), IE 9 and Firefox 20*
Pressing ENTER will trigger the event to be created

*Chrome 26.0.1410.64 m*
Pressing ENTER will NOT trigger the event to be created. The "Repeat every xx month/week/year/day" field is shown instead
fields.summary: Pressing ENTER on the "Repeat" drop down menu produces different behavior across different browsers

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49520].
  {panel}

UPM 2.9 introduces the ability to purchase add-ons for OnDemand customers, directly from inside the application.

However, Team Calendars has a custom popup to appear once the plugin is found to be licensed. With 2.9, we noticed that this popup can appear multiple times, happens overlaid on top of our progress bar, and covers up vital information.

Can we replace it with the standard {{post.install.url}} to keep it consistent with other add-ons?

http://screencast.com/t/4Aco4zCP - see the very end of the purchase flow. It only happens twice in this video but we've seen it happen more than that as well.

/cc [~smansour], [~merickson]

fields.description:
*Description:*
When creating an Event on Team Calendars to show Jira Agile Sprints, the Team Calendars shows the wrong *end date* on the *Timeline* view mode.
!example1.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce:*


First, on JIRA: 
# Create a new Agile board (Scrum Board).
1. Fill in the Board name, Project name and Project key as you wish.
2. Choose Agile Simplified Workflow.
# Create a new issue.
1. Select the Agile Project you have just created.
2. Choose any Issue Type (e.g: Bug).
3. Write something on Summary.
# Create a Sprint on your Agile Project.
# Drag and drop the issue you created into the sprint you have just created.
# Start the Sprint (you can let the default infos on the *Start Sprint* form).


Now, on Confluence Team Calendars:
# Create a new Calendar.
# Add an event in the calendar.
1. For "Event Type" select *JIRA Agile Sprints*
2. Select the Agile Project you created.
3. Write anything as a name for the event.
# Select the *Timeline* view mode.

Now you can see that the end date of the added Sprint is wrong. The sprint shows the right date, but the timeline ends a day after it.
fields.summary: Team Calendars showing the wrong end date for sprints on timeline view.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49494].
  {panel}

There were reports of EAC being unavailable. As per usual it was actually just slow/busy. Checking the GC logs showed the typical pattern we get associated with many outages although this time it actually recovered and started to free memory from the old generation -

!team-cal-gc.png!

Looking at the Simon monitoring in Confluence we see a single request to .../calendar/mycalendar.action with a start time of 20:17:23 and an end time of 20:39:21. Allowing for the difference timezones between us and the server this correlates very closely with the GC "incident".

fields.summary: Teamcal causing the old gen to fill and GC to become ineffective (and CPU effective) for over 20 minutes
Extra profile picture appearing in the email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49492].
  {panel}

We are experiencing My Calendars loading performance degradation over time, I assume it relates to growth of the amount of events in our calendars. Now we have reached the point where My Calendar loading takes more than 15 seconds in Team Calendars is actually gets unusable.

I searched the bug tracker for similar issues and I see that such problem is well know by developers but so far there is only promise that it will be fixed in next major version(for example, TEAMCAL-1911, TEAMCAL-485).

It is completely unacceptable - the product which we have bought is UNUSABLE, so this issue has to be treated with the highest priority!
I understand that the fix can not be trivial, so it makes sense to plan it for next major version, but in such case you have to provide us with some workaround - for example, DB tuning scripts, scripts to remove the old events etc.
fields.summary: Confluence Team Calendars slow loading

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49490].
  {panel}

I'm having problems adding Jira related Events to Team Calendars.
When I select "Add Event" and choose any of the Jira Event types, the additional options never load (like Project List) and there is a timeout after about 2 minutes. 

What's interesting is that when I Disable the ical 1.1 plugin in Jira and go back to Team Calendars, I'm able to proceed with adding a Jira event, the additional options load and I'm able to add the Event. But as soon as I add, there's a timeout right above the calendar itself and the Issue Dates never load. So I go back to Jira and enable ical 1.1 again. After that, Issue Dates are displayed on the Calendar properly.

h4.Steps to Reproduce: 

# Install Team Calendars 4.0.3.1 in Confluence
# Install Jira iCalendar plugin version 1.1 (latest one)
# Create a new Calendar in Team Calendars
# After created, click on "Add Event" option in the Calendar name (the arrow in the right side of the screen)
# Try to pick an JIRA even (Jira Project Releases, in example)
# You will receive a timeout error displayed in red in the "Create Even" screen not allowing you to proceed.
fields.summary: Team Calendar 4.0.3.1 and Jira JIRA iCalendar Plugin 1.1 times out

fields.description:
When using subscribed calendars as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Team+Calendars+from+Microsoft+Outlook the participants of an event are displayed differently for different calendar clients - see screenshots attached

This means that for iCal people they only see "Holiday" or "HO" instead of "Peter: Holiday", which makes the feed unusable for them

The file names contain the platforms/version numbers

h4.Workaround:

In google Calendar, locate the event that is throwing this error (In this example the event is TV14), and do the following:
- Click on it and press "Edit Event".
- Click on Time-zone to set the time-zone to a time-zone in Google Calendar and save.
- From calendar settings take the private URL of the calendar (iCal) and try to subscribe again.

Related to: TEAMCAL-1196
fields.summary: Events that span beyond the timeline view bounce when you horizontally scroll

fields.description:
We use JIRA Team Calendars in Confluence to track time-sensitive tasks (like promo start/end times/dates). It works really well, but it would be great if there were a way to set the time zone that data is displayed in.

Currently, the actual times shown in JIRA Team Calendars are taken from the JIRA server's system time and can't be adjusted. This causes some confusion and inconvenience. 

Thanks,
-Roger
fields.summary: Edit Time Zone for JIRA Team Calendars

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49482].
  {panel}

Preconditions
* create a user that called "test"
* login with admin on browser 1
* login with test on browser 2

Steps
* Admin: create a calendar and an event on it.
* Test: subscribe this calendar
* Admin: create a Travel event
* Test: refresh subscribed calendar
* => There are 2 Travel events (same name) on Test's calendar

* Admin: create a Leave event
* Test: refresh subscribed calendar
* => There are 4 Leave events (same name) on Test's calendar

Expected:
* There are only one Travel / Leave on Test's calendar

!Screen Shot 2014-04-23 at 2.19.24 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Leave and Travel are duplicated on Subscriber's calendar

fields.description:
h4.Summary
Users can publish their calendars in Outlook via WebDAV, which Team Calendars can then subscribe to. 
* A user can create an event in the shared calendar, and it appears correctly in Team Calendars after the calendar file has been updated on the WebDAV server.
* A second user can send invites to the first user, and the invites will appear correctly in Team Calendars if the second user is in the same or similar time zone to the first user (exact timezones to be affected is to be determined)

h4.Steps to Reproduce (Courtesy of Customer)
# On the Mac OSX, set the time zone as "London - Unitied Kingdom". Create an outlook account on Outlook Mac 2011 ensure the Calendar "Default time zoene for new events" is set to "(UTC) Greenwich Mean Time: Dublin, Edinburgh,..." We'll call this John's account.
# On Windows set the time zone as "(UTC+10:00) Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney)" In Outlook 2010 options -> Calendar the Timezone is also set to "(UTC+10:00) Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney)". We'll call this Leo's account
# Add one entry into Leo's Windows Outlook 2010 Calendar and share it on a Webdav server.
# Add the calendar to confluence using "Subscribe using URL", the single calendar entry for Leo is visible in the Confluence calendar.
# Send a meeting invite from John's Outlook Mac 2011 to the Leo's Windows Outlook. The calendar entry is added to Leo's calendar.
# Click on refresh on Leo's calendar within Confluence Team Calendars.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49480].
  {panel}

When adding a JIRA Event Calendar to Confluence, an issue that has the same createdDate and dueDate will not display in the calendar if you show a date range with createdDate and dueDate. The JQL/query that populates the calendar may need to be improved to capture this scenario.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

1. Create a JIRA project and add an issue with a due date in the future. Add another issue with a due date equal to the creation date.
2. Add a JIRA Calendar to a Confluence page, and under *Show* select a date range with start date of _Issue Created Date_ and end date of _Issue Due Date_.
3. When you view the calendar only the issue with a different creation and due date will display.
fields.summary: Team Calendar doesn't show issue if createdDate is same as dueDate

fields.description:
I look at your instructions for subscribing to a Google Calendar (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Google+Calendars+From+Confluence).  However, these instructions only work for private Google accounts.

I am trying to subscribe to a Calendar that's part of the Google Apps domain. There is no "Private" option there. So I shared the calendar with the public and used the ICAL Calendar Address URL. 

I add it to the Team Calendar and it doesn't give me any errors but it also doesn't show any of the events. With or without a username and password, though I shouldn't need one since it's not the "private" url.
fields.summary: Using the public iCal URL from "Google Apps" Calenar doesn't show any events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49450].
  {panel}

I have been having some problems with the subscription to Team Calendars using Outlook. We have created a big calendar system with about 15 different calendars. When we tried to subscribe to some of these calendars using Outlook it has been having trouble linking to the calendar. 

Unfortunately it seems to be different things that are causing the break in different calendars. I have one calendar called "Private Sector Buildings" and this subscription works fine, until I change the color of the calendar (and nothing else) and then it breaks. I have another calendar called "Delta Cities" and this one works fine if you change the color, but breaks if you try to edit the name of the calendar and nothing else. 

I have been trying to add the calendars through the Online Microsoft Portal and through Outlook 2007 and both of them have been having problems. 

I have been testing and have not been able to find why it is causing these problems. I cant find any one correlating thing that is causing this problem, it seems that for different calendars different things are causing this subscription break. 

I wish I had more information on this, but I wanted to pass on that I was having this problem.

Thanks,
Daniel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49435].
  {panel}

We are trying to retrieve issues, based on a custom field.  We'd like to create a "JIRA Issue Dates" event type, that retrieves all issues (regardless of project) where a custom field = 'FeatureX'.

To recreate the problem:
  * create a custom issue type
  * create a custom date field on the new issue type (FeatureDate)
  * create a second custom field (FeatureDesc)
  * try to retrieve issues using:
    FeatureDesc='FeatureX'
    We'd like to display the issues on the calendar, based on their   FeatureDate.

Unfortunately, the custom field 'FeatureDate' does not list as one of the options under the 'Single Date' heading.

But if our JQL begins with:
  Project='ProjectA'
then 'FeatureDate' is one of the options under the 'Single Date' heading.

So we can use the following JQL:
  Project='ProjectA' and FeatureDesc='FeatureX'
but not:
  FeatureDesc='FeatureX'
fields.summary: JQL only works when the first parameter entered is 'Project'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49427].
  {panel}

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
- Add a Calendar to a page in Confluence
- Make sure anonymous have permission to view the page
- Try to view the page without logging in (as anonymous) 

h4. In the Logs:
Upon user tries to view a page:
{code}
2014-05-12 10:49:34,422 ERROR [http-8090-7] [extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractCalendarDataStore] isUserSubCalendarCreator Could not check isUserSubCalendarCreator for null user
 -- url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/subcalendars.json | userName: anonymous | referer: http://localhost:8090/display/ds/testing
{code}

h4.Findings:

fields.description:
*Description:*
Each time the user edit a Calendar Event in series, as soon as the edit form is opened, the "Ends until" date changes to one day before automatically.

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Create an event in the calendar.
2. Set it to repeat daily (for example).
3. Select the "until" radio button.
4. Select a date to end.
5. Save it.
6. Edit the first occurrence (for example).
7. Uncheck the "Edit this instance only" check box.
8. See that "Ends until" date changed to one day before.
9. Save it.

Each time the event is edited, this behaviour occur.

Example:
Create a event:
- What: Test
- When: 03-Apr-2014 to 03-Apr-2014
- All day event checked
- Repeat: Daily
- Repeat every 1 day
- Ends until 24-Apr-2014
- Click on "OK" button.
(Attachment: create_event.png)

- Event successfully created.
(Attachment: event_created.png)

- Click on the first occurrence and select "Edit".
- The edit form will open showing the Ends until date 23-Apr-2014 automatically.
- Uncheck the "Edit this instance only" option.
(Attachment: edit_event.png)
- Click on OK.

- The event will end on 23-Apr-2014.
(Attachment: event_edited.png)
fields.summary: Editing a calendar event series subtracts one day

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49394].

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to _Calendars_ > _Add Event_.
# Set the same or equal start date time and end date time. (For example, 21-AUG-2014 08:00 to 08:00 21-AUG-2014) Error occurs upon pressing _OK_.

Please refer to {{date_time.png}} for occurred error. 

Team Calendars version 4.1.4 and older allows users to enter the same or equal start date time and end date time. Please refer to {{milestone.png}} for the differences. "Brown color" Milestones are created using Team Calendars version 4.1.4 and older. "Blue color" Milestone is created using Team Calendars version 4.2 and later that does not allow an event to have same or equal start date time and end date time.
fields.summary: Allow event to have same or equal start date time and end date time (Milestone)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49389].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of Confluence Team Calendars 5.3.x, [Calendars in space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/team-calendars-5-3-release-notes-776814122.html#TeamCalendars5.3ReleaseNotes-Calendarsinspace(s)] feature was introduced - which integrates Confluence Team Calendar with Confluence Space.

*Scenario 1*
Due to this, [importing _.ics_ Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/create-add-and-edit-calendars-654213559.html#Create,Add,andEditCalendars-Addothercalendars] feature then required _Related Space_ field.
This can be a tedious process for user who needs to import a large number of Calendars.

*Scenario 2*
For the upgraded Calendars from a version lower than 5.3.x, the _Related Space_ field will then be empty by default. 
Should the user like to associate their Calendar to a particular Space, they'd then need to do this for each Spaces one by one.

h3. Suggested Solution
To implement bulk update _Related Space_ field on Team Calendars 5.3 and above.
fields.summary: Implementation of Bulk Update Related Space field on Team Calendars 5.3 and above

  {panel}

I would like to create a calendar including customer milestones as all day events. The timeline view shall be used.

Problem:
If the zoom is insufficient, only parts of an all day event are visible and it is not possible to read the entire description (see also attached screenshots, popup appears only after selection). 

Solution:
Provide an option for all day events that displays an event like in the current implementation for JIRA issues (pinned to a date by a line / entire title displayed).
fields.summary: Option to view calendar events like JIRA issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49384].
  {panel}

When selecting a recurring meeting with an End Date, the End Date calendar invokes with the month of the current date. (See attached)

This is a minor inconvenience for the user if the Start Date selected is in a later month, as the user must then advance the calendar month to the desired date. 

Again, this is a very minor concern as the widget works great otherwise. It would just be convenient if the End Date calendar took the Start Date value into consideration and invoked the End Date calendar with the month specified in the Start Date field.

Thanks!
fields.summary: End Date calendar starts with current month rather than Start Date month.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49383].
  {panel}

When searching for a Team Calendar, the results vary significantly depending on how I search.  For my example, we have an Event Calendar for each instance of Jira we are using.  I'm using this method to get to Search Calendar:
From my calendar, Add Calendar, Existing Calendar, Search for Calendar

Available Calendars:
Jira RPD Production
Jira IFS Production
Jira GBS Production
Jira Enterprise Production
Jira CO Production
Jira Bank Production

Here are the search results depending on what the input is:
When I type - 
	Jira = no results
	Jira rpd = no results
	Jira Production = no results
	Jira RPD Production = no results
	"Jira RPD" = Jira RPD Production (same result for all other instances)
	"Jira RPD Production" = Jira RPD Production
	"Jira ifs" = Jira IFS Production shows for half a second, then displays - No results (case sensitive?)  can only replicate if it's first time search.  Once found, it seems to find consistently.
	Production = all 6 results (with or without quotes)

I get the same results in Chrome and Firefox.  Also, the results do not seem to be improved by doing a Calendar Index.
There is a screen shot for these search results.
Sorry for the amount of screenshots, I don't have the ability to do a screen video record.
fields.summary: Team Calendars Search is inconsistent
